Question1: Write your motivation why you should be accepted into the Sourcery  Academy for Test Engineer.
Question2: Tell us about a time you made a decision that led to negative consequences. What would you do differently now?
Question3: Imagine you are working in a large vehicle park. How would you go about testing the vehicles to ensure they are ready to use? What personal skills or past experience would you apply during the process to make sure everything is in proper working condition?
Question4: Imagine you live in an apartment on the 5th floor of a residential building. You also have a parking space and a storage unit, which can be accessed from the parking area. One of the door locks is broken. How would you decide if it's urgent to fix it? How would the level of urgency change depending on which door has the broken lock?
